title: What is Bioinformatics?

Bioinformatics
Image of the different fields

title: What is Bioinformatics?
text:
Origin Story

1960s: Over 10 years before the development of DNA sequencing
The Edman degradation method for protein sequencing could only sequence them in small fragments of 50-60 amino acids
Margaret Dayhoff and Robert S. Ledley developed the first bioinformatics software, COMPROTEIN to assemble the fragments into the full structure of each protein

title: Welcome To My Blog
text: Welcome! This is the first post in my new Quarto blog. I will be sharing bioinformatics content here, my goal is to make the tutorials and content I share as approachable as possible with an emphasis on developing practical skills.

title: What is Bioinformatics?
text: Bioinformatics: An interdisciplinary field that develops computational methods and software tools to analyze and interpret large, complex biological datasets using biology, computer science, mathematics, and statistics.

title: What is Bioinformatics?
text:
DNA Sequencing

1977: The first cost effective method of sequencing DNA is developed by Frederick Sanger
Allowed for ~450 bases of DNA to be sequenced
1976: The first fully seqeunced genome (Bacteriophage MS2)
1979: The first DNA bioinformatics software is developed by Roger Staden

title: What is Bioinformatics?
text:
1980s

Parallel advances in biology and computer science
1983: PCR amplification is invented by Kary Mullis
1984: the University of Wisconsin Genetics Computer Group published the ‚ÄòGCG‚Äô software suite for DNA, RNA and protein analysis.
Bioinformatic analysis was now possible on personal computers
1985: Computer Applications in the Biosciences (CABIOS), the first bioinformatics journal is established

title: What is Bioinformatics?
text:
The Human Genome Project

1990: Initiated by the U.S. National Institutes of Health
Cost $2.7 billion in taxpayer money (in 1991 dollars)
Completed in 2003
Several pioneer software were developed in the mid to late 1990s to assemble the whole-genome sequencing reads

title: What is Bioinformatics?
text:
Next Generation Sequencing

2003: ‚Äò454‚Äô pyrosequencing and sequencing by synthesis (SBS) technologies were invented, allowing for the sequencing of millions of DNA molecules in a single machine run
2014: Cost to sequence a human genome drops to $1000
